problem:
A standard six-sided die was rolled 50 times, and the outcomes are shown in the table. What is the average of the 50 outcomes? Express your answer as a decimal to the nearest hundredth. \begin{tabular}{|c|c|}
\hline
Outcome&$\#$ of Occurrences\\\hline
1&14\\\hline
2&5\\\hline
3&9\\\hline
4&7\\\hline
5&7\\\hline
6&8\\\hline
\end{tabular}
solution: The total of the 50 outcomes is $(14 \times 1) + (5 \times 2) + (9 \times 3) + (7 \times 4) + (7 \times 5) + (8 \times 6) = 14 + 10 + 27 + 28 + 35 + 48 = 162.$ Dividing this by 50, we find that the average roll was $\boxed{3.24}$.
model_solution:
Step 1: Calculate the sum of all the outcomes.
\begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|}
\hline
Outcome&$\#$ of Occurrences&Outcome $\cdot \#$ of Occurrences\\\hline
1&14&14\\\hline
2&5&10\\\hline
3&9&27\\\hline
4&7&28\\\hline
5&7&35\\\hline
6&8&48\\\hline
\end{tabular}
Step 2: Add all the products in the last column to find the total of all the outcomes: $14+10+27+28+35+48=162.$
Step 3: Divide the total of all the outcomes by the number of trials to find the average: $\dfrac{162}{50}=3.24$
Step 4: Round the result to the nearest hundredth.
Step 4: Round 3.24 to the nearest hundredth.
The final answer is: $\boxed{3.24}$
